snippet: The workers at Rio de Janeiro’s airports said they would go on a 24-hour strike on Thursday, the opening day of the World Cup soccer tournament.
abstract: Workers at Rio de Janeiro’s airports say they will go on a 24-hour strike on the opening day of the World Cup soccer tournament; say they are seeking better conditions and a new collective bargaining agreement.
lead_paragraph: The workers at Rio de Janeiro’s airports said they would go on a 24-hour strike on Thursday, the opening day of the World Cup soccer tournament.

headline.main: Brazil: With World Cup Near, Airport Staff Plans Strike
headline.print_headline: Brazil: With World Cup Near, Airport Staff Plans Strike
